title: Is light a particle or a wave? - Colm Kelleher

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: Because light is made up of particles that don't interact with each other.

options.label: D
options.text: Because light is made up of waves.

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: A pattern made up of both particles and waves.

options.label: C
options.text: A combination of particles and waves.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it reflects light from a source.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is made up of tiny, atom-like particles.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it behaves like a wave.

title: You are your microbes - Jessica Green and Karen Guillemin

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the microbial communities that inhabit each human body?

options.label: C
options.text: They are only found in the gut

options.label: D
options.text: They are only found in the skin

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of cellulolytic bacteria in the digestive tract?
What is the role of respirators in the digestive tract?

options.label: C
options.text: To snatch up simple sugars and burn them as fuel

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of fermentors in the digestive tract?

options.label: C
options.text: To convert sugars into chemicals like alcohol and hydrogen gas

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of syntrophs in the digestive tract?

options.label: C
options.text: To eke out a living off the fermenters' trash

multiple-choice.question: What determines the membership of our gut microbial community?

options.label: C
options.text: Our genetic makeup and the microbes we encounter throughout our lives

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of eating a diet of simple molecules, like a lollipop, on the gut microbial community?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the variety of microbial workers

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the variety of microbial workers

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the variety of microbial workers

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the number of fermentors

multiple-choice.question: What is the typical characteristic of gut microbial communities in humans who suffer from diseases like diabetes or chronic gut inflammation?

options.label: A
options.text: They have a high variety of microbial workers

options.label: B
options.text: They have a low variety of microbial workers

options.label: C
options.text: They have a balanced mix of microbial workers

options.label: D
options.text: They have a high number of fermentors

multiple-choice.question: What is the likely way to manage our individual microbial societies?

options.label: B
options.text: By changing our diet to include more simple molecules

options.label: C
options.text: By changing our lifestyle to include a varied diet of complex, plant-based foods

options.label: D
options.text: By ignoring our gut microbial community

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between our microbes and our bodies?

options.label: A
options.text: We need them, but they don't need us

options.label: B
options.text: They need us, but we don't need them

options.label: C
options.text: We need them just as much as they need us

options.label: D
options.text: We don't need them at all
